intro: Licania operculipetala, commonly known as the hooded licania, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hooded calyx that covers the flower bud. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Licania operculipetala plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
